wikipedia_page.main: Hugh Graham Stack FRCS (7 December 1915 – 28 May 1992) was a British orthopaedic surgeon with a specialism in surgery of the hand. He was secretary of the Second Hand Club and was instrumental in the merger of the British hand surgery organisations to become the British Society for Surgery of the Hand.

response: *Graham Stack (record producer), English born record producer and songwriter

link_mentions.page: British Society for Surgery of the Hand
response: The society was formed as the Second Hand Club in 1956 at the instigation of Graham Stack after the original Hand Club, formed by plastic surgeon Patrick Clarkson in 1952, refused to admit younger surgeons.Our History. British Society for Surgery of the Hand. Retrieved 25 July 2018.Stack, Hugh Graham (1915 - 1992). Plarr's Lives of the Fellows Online, British College of Surgeons. Retrieved 20 August 2018.
